newsitem.title: GREECE: Greece offers way out to conscientious objectors.
newsitem.headline: Greece offers way out to conscientious objectors.

text.p: Greek Defence Minister Akis Tsohatzopoulos said on Sunday conscientious objectors would soon be able to serve an alternative to military service.

Tsohatzopoulos told a conference of Greeks living abroad that the socialist government would introduce legislation under which objectors, estimated at around 2,500 in Greece, would serve their time in the public sector.
They would be able to work in public hospitals or municipal services for double the regular military service period of 19 months.
Military courts in Greece often jail conscientious objectors and international human rights groups have criticised the country providing no alternative to military service.
